dataIdInfo.idAbs: Calculates statistics for a variable in a multidimensional dataset, such as netCDF or HDF.

tool.name: GetVariableStatistics

param.name: in_file
param.dialogReference: The full path or URL of the multidimensional dataset.
param.pythonReference: The full path or URL of the multidimensional dataset.

param.name: variable
param.dialogReference: The variable for the statistic to be calculated over.
param.pythonReference: The variable for the statistic to be calculated over.

param.name: statistic_type
param.expression: {MEAN | MAJORITY | MAXIMUM | MEDIAN | MINIMUM | MINORITY | RANGE | STD | SUM | VARIANCE | VARIETY}
param.pythonReference: Statistic type to be calculated. Valid types are {MAJORITY | MAXIMUM | MEAN | MEDIAN | MINIMUM | MINORITY | RANGE | STD | SUM | VARIANCE | VARIETY}. The default statistic is MEAN. The MAJORITY, MEDIAN, MINORITY, and VARIETY statistics will only operate on variables with an integer data type.
param.dialogReference:
Statistic type to be calculated.

  • MEAN — Calculates the mean (average) of the input variable (default).

  • MAJORITY — Determines the majority (value that occurs most often) in the input variable.

  • MAXIMUM — Determines the maximum (largest value) of the input variable.

  • MEDIAN — Calculates the median of the input variable.

  • MINIMUM — Determines the minimum (smallest value) of the input variable.

  • MINORITY — Determines the minority (value that occurs least often) in the input variable.

  • RANGE — Calculates the range (difference between largest and smallest value) of the input variable.

  • STD — Calculates the standard deviation of the input variable.

  • SUM — Calculates the sum (total of all values) of the input variable.

  • VARIANCE — Calculates the variance (squared standard deviation) of the input variable.

  • VARIETY — Calculates the variety (number of unique values) in the input variable.

If no statistic is selected, MEAN will be used by default.

For MAJORITY and MINORITY, when there is a tie the output statistic is the lowest of the tied values.

The MAJORITY, MEDIAN, MINORITY, and VARIETY statistics will only operate on variables with an integer data type.

tool.summary: Calculates statistics for a variable in a multidimensional dataset, such as netCDF or HDF.
tool.usage:
• For MAJORITY and MINORITY, when there is a tie the output statistic is the lowest of the tied values.

  • The MAJORITY, MEDIAN, MINORITY, and VARIETY statistics will only operate on variables with an integer data type.

scriptExample.title: GetVariableStatistics example 1 (local dataset)
scriptExample.para: Calculates the maximum value occurring in the pptx variable.
scriptExample.code:
import arcpy
# Import the supplemental toolbox. arcpy.ImportToolbox("c:/data/Multidimension Supplemental Tools.pyt")
arcpy.GetVariableStatistics_mds("c:/data/netcdf/dataset.nc","pptx","MAXIMUM")

scriptExample.title: GetVariableStatistics example 2 (remote dataset)
scriptExample.para: Calculates the maximum value occurring in the pptx variable.
scriptExample.code:
import arcpy
# Import the supplemental toolbox. arcpy.ImportToolbox("c:/data/Multidimension Supplemental Tools.pyt")
arcpy.GetVariableStatistics_mds("http://www.opendap_server.com/data/dataset.nc","pptx","MAXIMUM")
